sub_title: Compliance Manager Netherlands at GlaxoSmithKline B.V.
summary:
I love to read, work in the garden and spend time with my family and friends. I love writing. We have a wide variety of friends in different cultures and with different backgrounds. I truly believe this colours the world and makes life more beautiful. Mutual respect is at the heart of everything I do and what I teach my children.

I have excellent communication skills in both Dutch and English. 
Although I haven’t used my German and French vocabulary recently, the words I know help me relate to people on a personal level quite quickly. I can read German on a proficient level.

I am a fast learner, very autodidactic and broadly interested.
I am very proactive when I see opportunities for improvement both in business and private life. I believe in an ongoing development and constant evolving.
I love to work closely with colleagues to find solutions for difficult problems.
I am direct, open and honest and love to use humour to put things in perspective.

In work, I go for the bigger picture without losing focus on the details.

profile_positions.description:
•	Member of local Risk Management & Compliance Board (RMCB).
•	Prepare RMCB agenda. 
•	Manage RMCB site
•	Create a standard Management Monitoring process based on local Risk Map and audit outcomes. To assist the business I have created a Management Monitoring Assistance Pack with advice on choice of samples and which departments can be contacted for help during the process. This resulted in a uniform outcome template that could be discussed during the RMCB.
•	Extensive contact with departments around Management Monitoring process and outcomes.
•	Provide active input for revaluating Risk Map.
•	Provide active input for yearly GM Confirmation.
•	Re-assess current framework around Written Standards & Controls to define where simplifications can and must me made to create a better compliance with SOP’s. Simplifications in SOP content, number of SOP’s and platform.
•	Performing an assessment of the Training Framework to find out where improvements could be made. 
•	Restructuring compliance and RMCB way of working to follow the Internal Control Framework topics.
•	Proactive reporting of (potential) risks to Management.
•	Business Partner to commercial business in finding solutions for difficult situations.
•	Review and approve Note to Files, Red flags and exceptions to policies.
•	Member of the Non Standard Initiatives board
•	Lead an extensive A&A audit Q2 2018 with an International A&A team of 8 people during a time of heavy restructuring, new GM and launch of new product.
profile_positions.title: Ethics and Compliance Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Advise on legal and reputational risks related to proposed marketing and sales strategies
•	Seek to minimize risk while being proactive in delivering pragmatic and compliant solutions for the business
•	Addressing and advising on legal matters with diplomacy and tact 
•	Member of the local Medical Governance Board.
•	Drafting and assessing external communication to eg IGJ, lawyers
•	Alignment around competitor complaints
•	Actively contributed to the process around an IGZ investigation and internal communication about report outcomes, on a local and global level
•	Prepare internal business communication  
•	Monthly contact with the Regional Privacy Manager on privacy related issues and future developments
•	Member of the industry association of innovative pharmaceutical companies (VIG)
•	Corporate Secretary: Created a Board Information Package for onboarding new board members. 
•	Corporate Secretary: Assist during international BD deals. 
•	Develop, create and implement a community within the GSK intranet containing Written Standards & Controls. The first version of what is now called, Sop Navigator
•	Member of the Non Standard Initiatives board together with Compliance Officer, Medical Director and Legal Director. Business Owners contacted me for a first assessment and to prepare documentation or final review.
